verb.description: Develop gradually, especially from a simple to a more complex form.
examples: the company has evolved into a major chemical manufacturer
the Gothic style evolved steadily and naturally from the Romanesque
each school must evolve its own way of working

origin: Early 17th century (in the general sense make more complex, develop): from Latin evolvere, from e- (variant of ex-) out of + volvere to roll.
